title: How do you increase the height of a font without distortion.
content: Hi, I apologize if this isn't the right forum, I'm new! I am wondering how to increase the height of a font, without increasing the width and without ruining its aesthetic by having it look stretched and distorted. Are there any tricks to do this. Thanks!
author: Ninth Kingdom

comments.content:
You'd have to edit it manually which would require having a license to do that. Alternatively, if you have a condensed face, just make that larger, or maybe a condensed light face.

_«El futuro es una línea tan fina que apenas nos damos cuenta de pintarla nosotros mismos». (La Luz Oscura, por Javier Guerrero)_
If you have more than one weight of the font you can create a multiple master font and use Font Remix Tools to do it.

Well, maybe you wouldn't "ruin" it, but of course you would be changing the aesthetic of a font quite deeply by making it narrower (which is a better way to think about it than "taller").

Anyway, if quality is important, you have to do it by hand.  
More: [http://typophile.com/node/42930](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109011406/http:/typophile.com/node/42930 "http://typophile.com/node/42930")
